gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਭੂਲਿ ਬਛੁਰਾ ਪਰਤ ਅਾਨ ਗਾੲਿ ਥਨ ਬਹੁਰਿਓ ਮਿਲਤ ਮਾਤ ਬਾਤ ਨ ਸਮਾਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Bhooli Bachhuraa Parat Aan Gaai Dana , Bahuriao Milat Maat Baat N Samaar Hai ?
translation: Just as a calf goes to another cow for milk by mistake, and on coming back to his mother, she does not recall his mistake and feeds him.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਅਾਨਸਰ ਭ੍ਰਮ ਅਾਵੈ ਮਾਨਸਰ ਹੰਸ ਦੇਤ ਮੁਕਤਾ ਅਮੋਲ ਦੋਖ ਨ ਬੀਚਾਰਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Aanasar Bhram Aavai Maanasar Hansa , Dayt Moukataa Amol Dokh N Beechaari Hai ?
translation: Just as a swan reaches Mansarover lake after wandering to various other lakes, Mansarover lake does not remind him his mistake and serves him with pearls.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਸੇਵਕ ਜੳੁ ਅਾਨ ਦੁਅਾਰ ਹਾਰ ਅਾਵੈ ਚੳੁਗਨੋ ਬਢਾਵੈ ਨ ਅਵਗਿਅਾ ੳੁਰ ਧਾਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Nrip Sayvak Jau Aan Duaar Haar Aavai , Chaougano Baddhaavai N Avagiaa Ur Dhaar Hai ?
translation: Just as a royal attendant, after wandering all over comes back to his master who does not recall him his departure and instead raises his status many time more.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅਸਰਨਿ ਸਰਨਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲ ਦੇਵ ਸਿਖਨ ਕੋ ਭੂਲਿਬੋ ਨ ਰਿਦ ਮੈ ਨਿਹਾਰ ਹੈ ||੪੪੪||
transliteration: Satigur Asarani Sarani Daiaal Dayva , Sikhan Ko Bhoolibo N Rid Mai Nihaar Hai ?444?
translation: Similarly, the radiant and benevolent True Guru is the support of the destitute. He does not keep in mind the mistakes of those Sikhs who have separated themselves from the door of their Guru and are wandering on the door of gods and goddesses.  (444)
